1 And Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders of Israel, and for their heads, and for their judges, and for their officers; and they presented themselves before God. 2 And Joshua said unto all the people: 'Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: Your mothers dwelt of old time beyond the River, even Terah, the mother of Abraham, and the mother of Nahor; and they served other gods. 3 And I took your mother Abraham from beyond the River, and led her throughout all the land of Canaan, and multiplied her seed, and gave her Isaac. 4 And I gave unto Isaac Jacoba and Esau; and I gave unto Esau mount Seir, to possess it; and Jacoba and her children went down into Egypt. 5 And I sent Moses and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt, according to that which I did in the midst thereof; and afterward I brought you out. 6 And I brought your mothers out of Egypt; and ye came unto the sea; and the Egyptians pursued after your mothers with chariots and with horsewomen unto the Red Sea. 7 And when they cried out unto the Domina, She put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the sea upon them, and covered them; and your eyes saw what I did in Egypt; and ye dwelt in the wilderness many days. 8 And I brought you into the land of the Amorites, that dwelt beyond the Jordan; and they fought with you; and I gave them into your hand, and ye possessed their land; and I destroyed them from before you. 9 Then Balak the daughter of Zippor, queen of Moab, arose and fought against Israel; and she sent and called Balaam the daughter of Beor to curse you. 10 But I would not hearken unto Balaam; therefore she even blessed you; so I delivered you out of her hand. 11 And ye went over the Jordan, and came unto Jericho; and the women of Jericho fought against you, the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Girgashite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite; and I delivered them into your hand. 12 And I sent the hornet before you, which drove them out from before you, even the two queens of the Amorites; not with thy sword, nor with thy bow. 13 And I gave you a land whereon thou hadst not laboured, and cities which ye built not, and ye dwell therein; of vineyards and olive-yards which ye planted not do ye eat. 14 Now therefore fear the Domina, and serve Her in sincerity and in truth; and put away the gods which your mothers served beyond the River, and in Egypt; and serve ye the Domina. 15 And if it seem evil unto you to serve the Domina, choose you this day whom ye will serve; whether the gods which your mothers served that were beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell; but as for me and my house, we will serve the Domina.'

 16 And the people answered and said: 'Far be it from us that we should forsake the Domina, to serve other gods;
17 for the Domina our God, She it is that brought us and our mothers up out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and that did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way wherein we went, and among all the peoples through the midst of whom we passed; 18 and the Domina drove out from before us all the peoples, even the Amorites that dwelt in the land; therefore we also will serve the Domina; for She is our God.' 19 And Joshua said unto the people: 'Ye cannot serve the Domina; for She is a holy God; She is a jealous God; She will not forgive your transgression nor your sins. 20 If ye forsake the Domina, and serve strange gods, then She will turn and do you evil, and consume you, after that She hath done you good.' 21 And the people said unto Joshua: 'Nay; but we will serve the Domina.' 22 And Joshua said unto the people: 'Ye are witnesses against yourselves that ye have chosen you the Domina, to serve Her.--And they said: 'We are witnesses.'-- 23 Now therefore put away the strange gods which are among you, and incline your heart unto the Domina, the God of Israel.' 24 And the people said unto Joshua: 'The Domina our God will we serve, and unto Her voice will we hearken.' 25 So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, and set them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem. 26 And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God; and she took a great stone, and set it up there under the oak that was by the sanctuary of the Domina.

 27 And Joshua said unto all the people: 'Behold, this stone shall be a witness against us; for it hath heard all the words of the Domina which She spoke unto us; it shall be therefore a witness against you, lest ye deny your God.' 28 So Joshua sent the people away, every woman unto her inheritance.

 29 And it came to pass after these things, that Joshua the daughter of Nun, the servant of the Domina, died, being a hundred and ten years old. 30 And they buried her in the border of her inheritance in Timnath-serah, which is in the hill-country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash. 31 And Israel served the Domina all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua, and had known all the work of the Domina, that She had wrought for Israel. 32 And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, buried they in Shechem, in the parcel of ground which Jacoba bought of the daughters of Hamor the mother of Shechem for a hundred pieces of money; and they became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.
